revision.text:
{{infobox music festival | music_festival_name = | image = Afropunk Fest 2013 (9695793808).jpg | caption = [[Danny Brown]] performing at Afropunk Festival, August 2013 | location = | years_active = 2005-present | founders = James Spooner, Matthew Morgan | dates = | genre = alternative, blues, R&B, hip-hop, electronic, rock | website = {{URL|http://afropunkfest.com/}} |attendance=70,000}}
The '''Afropunk Festival''' (commonly referred to as '''Afropunk''' or '''Afropunk Fest''') is an annual arts festival that includes live music, film, fashion, and art produced by black artists. The festival made its first debut at the [[Brooklyn Academy of Music]] (BAM) in 2005, and has since expanded to other parts of the world. Originally co-founded by [[James Spooner]] and Matthew Morgan, the festival was inspired by Spooner's 2003 documentary film ''[[Afro-Punk (film)|Afro-Punk]], which'' spotlighted black punks across America and later culminated in a series of live shows entitled "The Liberation Sessions" co-curated by Spooner and Morgan.<ref>[https://www.villagevoice.com/2013/08/21/afropunk-started-with-a-documentary-ten-years-two-websites-and-eight-festivals-later/ ''AfroPunk Started With a Documentary''], Village Voice</ref> The festival originally sought to provide black people an opportunity to build community within the predominantly white [[punk subculture]] and to provide a stage for black alternative performers that were not acknowledged in the mainstream and stood outside hip hop, R&B, soul, etc.<ref name="Giorgis" /> To attract a wider audience, the festival shifted to include [[soul music]] and [[hip hop]], which expanded its target demographic, attracting headliners including [[Ice Cube]], [[Lauryn Hill]], [[Lenny Kravitz]], and [[Gary Clark, Jr.]].<ref name="Giorgis">{{cite news |first=Hannah |last=Giorgis |date=August 26, 2015 |title=Gentrifying Afropunk |newspaper=[[The New Yorker]] |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/news/lenny-kravitz-lauryn-hill-grace-jones-to-headline-afropunk-nyc-20150602 |accessdate=September 24, 2015 }}</ref> Musical performers now represent a variety of genres, primarily known to reflect African-American culture.
Afropunk's changes to its diverse cultural showcase has allowed for the festival to build its masses to 60,000 attendees.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/is-the-afropunk-festival-no-longer-punk-813|title=Is Afropunk Fest No Longer Punk?|last=Josephs|first=Brian|date=August 17, 2015|website=VICE|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=March 7, 2017}}</ref> Due to festival alterations that deviated from the original Afropunk culture, former co-founder, James Spooner made the decision to end his involvement in 2008. Soon after, Jocelyn Cooper was introduced to the festival as co-organizer, broadening Afropunk Fest to Atlanta, Paris, London, and Johannesburg, South Africa.
== History ==
=== 2003-2005 === James Spooner debuted his 66-minute documentary film ''Afro-Punk'' in 2003. It explores the lives of black youth within a white punk subculture with the aim of expanding notions of blackness and reclaiming rock's roots by providing a platform for black artists that were not given the opportunity elsewhere. Growing up bi-racial, on the streets of New York City, Spooner discovered and connected with the punk music scene and its culture but also felt alienated from both his white peers in the scene and the black community outside the scene. After examining the world of hardcore punk in America at the time, and noticing the lack of people of color, along with the absence of dialogue around race despite its activist leanings, he began to question what it means to be black within alternative scenes. Digging deeper into the subject of race became the inspiration for his documentary. Traveling throughout the United States and abroad, Spooner followed the lives of four African Americans who submerged and dedicated their lives to the punk rock scene and its values. Through exclusive interviews with punks and various punk rock bands including, [[Fishbone]], [[24-7 Spyz]], and [[Dead Kennedys]], Spooner's documentary covered issues of loneliness, exile, inter-racial dating, and the double lives people of color lead within a predominately white sub-cultured community.<ref>[https://www.villagevoice.com/2013/08/21/afropunk-started-with-a-documentary-ten-years-two-websites-and-eight-festivals-later/ ''AfroPunk Started With a Documentary''], Village Voice</ref>
Spooner toured the film throughout the United States and the world, screening it over 300 times and garnering followers and building community. He then created a message board to connect alternative black people from around the world. Soon after he held shows to foster that community. Shows included Bad Brains Tributes, The Double Consciousness Rock series at CBGBs, a west coast tour and screening with Ricky Fitts, and others.<ref>[https://nylon.com/articles/afropunk-punk-roots-2017 ''Looking for The Punk That's Gone Missing''], Nylon Magazine</ref>
Spooner was later interested in having the black fronted rock band Stiffed perform after one of his screenings. He contacted Santi White's manager, Matthew Morgan, who thought that the opportunity would be a vehicle to get Santi signed.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.thefader.com/2015/08/21/james-spooner-afropunk|title=The True Story of How Afropunk Turned A Message Board Into A Movement|last=Kameir|first=Rawiya|date=21 August 2015|website=The Fader|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=11 May 2017}}</ref> After success with Spooner's film and the live events, the two began to collaborate on a party called the Liberation Sessions, which promoted black artistry via music and film. Two years later, they would go on to create the Afropunk Music and Film Festival from 2005 to 2008 in conjunction with the Brooklyn Academy of Music.<ref>[https://thebridgebk.com/how-brooklyns-afropunk-fest-grew-from-indie-to-global/ ''How Brooklyn's AfroFest Became A Global Brand''], The Bridge Magazine</ref>
=== AFROPUNK.com === After being featured at the [[Toronto International Film Festival]], [[American Black Film Festival]], and the Pan African Film & Arts Festival, ''AfroPunk'' began receiving multiple awards and forms of recognition from all over the world. With ''Afro-Punk''<nowiki/>'s rising notability, Spooner mobilized the black punk rock community he had created on Afropunk.com's message board. The message board gained thousands of members with common interests: black punk rock music and values.<ref>[http://www.thefader.com/2015/08/21/james-spooner-afropunk ''The True Story of How AfroPunk Turned a Message Board Into a Movement''], Fader Magazine</ref>
On September 5, 2018, Lou Constant-Desportes, founding editor-in-chief of AFROPUNK.com, announced his resignation citing "performative 'activism' dipped in consumerism and '[[woke]]' keywords used for marketing purposes," as well as "lies, gaslighting, disrespect, victim-blaming, exploitation, not to mention overworked, undervalued and underpaid staff being kept in precarious situations."<ref>{{cite news |last=Darville |first=Jordan |url=https://www.thefader.com/2018/09/05/afropunk-editor-resigns-cites-performative-activism-employee-mistreatment-open-letter |title=AFROPUNK editor resigns, cites “performative activism,” employee mistreatment |work=Fader |date=2018-09-05 |accessdate=2018-09-06 }}</ref>
=== 2005-2008 === Afropunk, the festival, was created as a safe space for black alternative-minded punks to freely express themselves and build a community with one another. The festival was free and was supported by The Brooklyn Academy of Music. As the festival grew larger, reaching larger demographics, the presence of punk culture began to shift toward a larger audience, focusing more on neo-soul, pop, or hip hop performances. Along with the notable change in the festival's focused genre, the festival also began charging admission prices. As Afropunk became scantily punk, moving away from its origins and original demographic, James Spooner also departed. During Afropunk's fourth festival, a rap-reggea-punk band performed a cover of [[Buju Banton]]'s, "Boom Bye Bye," which caused controversy with the black queer community, one of Afropunk's core target demographic groups. Spooner jumped on stage and denounced the song and its presence at the festival. Disheartened with how Morgan was deviating from Afropunk's original values, and transitioning the festival more towards a mainstream audience, James Spooner departed in 2008.<ref>[https://ny.racked.com/2015/8/20/9180091/afropunk-festival-history ''How AfroPunk Became a Full Blown Movement''], Racked Magazine</ref>
=== 2009 - Present === After James Spooner's departure in 2008, music industry veteran, Jocelyn Cooper joined Matthew Morgan in 2009. As the former head of A&R at Universal, Cooper transitioned into Afropunk's music festival by aiding in the development of their sponsorships and directing Multiply, Afropunk's marketing, content, and advertising agency. With Cooper's involvement, she's was able to secure brand partnership deals with [[MillerCoors]], [[Toyota]], [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]], and [[Pantene]]. As Jocelyn developed relationships with major companies, giving her the opportunity to broaden Afropunk across seas, she was able to expand the Brooklyn-based summer festival from 2,500 attendees to 90,000 among multiple cities, including Atlanta in 2015 and Paris and London in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.fastcompany.com/3043954/jocelyn-cooper|title=Jocelyn Cooper|last=Naasel|first=Kenrya|date=11 May 2015|website=Fast Company|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=11 May 2017}}</ref> New to the roster for its 2017 festival tour will include Johannesburg, South Africa.
=== Criticisms === Having emerged from political punk roots, Afropunk Fest has faced criticism throughout its history,<ref>[https://mg.co.za/article/2017-05-19-00-afropunks-growing-gains-and-pains ''AfroPunk's Growing Pains''], Mail & Guardian</ref> including backlash over booking choices such as MIA (a non black performer who critiqued the Black Lives Matter Movement),<ref>[https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2016/09/12/aim-and-mias-provocative-pop ''M.I.A.'s Provocative Pop''], The New Yorker</ref> Ice Cube (a rapper with past accusations of misogyny),<ref>[https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/ice-cube-defends-misogyny-in-nwa-lyrics_us_55ce1c35e4b055a6dab03267 ''Ice Cube Justifies Lyrics...''], Huffington Post</ref> Tyler the Creator (a performer with a history of homophobia and lyrics normalizing rape),<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/music/2011/may/08/odd-future-tyler-creator-rape ''Rappers and Rape''], The Guardian</ref> along with others. Attendees have also critiqued the values of Afropunk's organizers surrounding LGBQT concerns, treatment of employees, and its corporate leanings. Some attendees critique the festival for appealing to white audiences<ref>[https://www.teenvogue.com/story/cultural-appropriation-ally-afropunk ''How to be a Good Ally at AfroPunk'']</ref>, including an instance of attendees being removed from an area of the festival for wearing a homemade t-shirt critical of the event.<ref>[https://www.theroot.com/couple-thrown-out-of-afropunk-for-protest-t-shirt-quest-1828793292 ''Couple Thrown Out Of AfroPunk VIP''], The Root</ref> In August of 2018, Afropunk's Editor-In-Chief resigned after over a decade of work for Afropunk citing mistreatment and a corporate agenda he labeled "performative activism".<ref>[https://www.thefader.com/2018/09/05/afropunk-editor-resigns-cites-performative-activism-employee-mistreatment-open-letter ''AFROPUNK Editor Resigns'']</ref> There are also lawsuits and other reports of abuse that have been circulating the festival. <ref>[https://www.vibe.com/2018/10/afropunk-festival-staff-reports-abuse/ ''Festival Staff Abuse, Vibe Magazine'']</ref>
==Notable performers== {{columns-list|colwidth=35em| * [[D'Angelo]] * [[Kelis]] * [[Lianne La Havas]] * [[Lauryn Hill]] * [[Suicidal Tendencies]] * [[Grace Jones]] * [[Lenny Kravitz]] * [[Gary Clark, Jr.]] * [[Sharon Jones (singer)|Sharon Jones]] * [[Bad Brains]] * [[Shinobi Ninja]] * [[The Suffers]] * [[Shabazz Palaces]] * [[Body Count (band)|Body Count]] * [[Chuck D]] * [[DJ Lord]] * [[Questlove]] * [[Mykki Blanco]]<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2014/08/21/arts/music/afropunk-festival-hosts-60-acts-over-two-days-in-brooklyn.html?_r=0 Afropunk Festival Hosts 60 Acts Over Two Days in Brooklyn - NYTimes.com]</ref> * [[Death (protopunk band)|Death]] * [[Rye Rye]] * [[Danny Brown (rapper)|Danny Brown]] * [[the London Souls]] * [[Theophilus London]] * [[Wicked Wisdom]] * [[Jean Grae]] * [[Eve]]<ref>[http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/music-arts/diverse-african-american-artists-afropunk-fest-brooklyn-article-1.1433059 African-American artists play in every style at the Afropunk Festival in Fort Greene, Brooklyn - NY Daily News]</ref> * [[Trash Talk (band)|Trash Talk]] * [[Sho Madjozi]] * [[Manthe Ribane]] * [[Nakhane]] * [[SZA (singer)|SZA]] * [[Unlocking the Truth]]<ref>[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/08/25/afropunk-festival-street-style-2014_n_5709757.html The Dopest Street Style Snaps From AfroPunk Fest 2014]</ref> * [[Lolawolf]]<ref name="Spanos">{{cite news |first=Brittany |last=Spanos |date=June 2, 2015 |title=Lenny Kravitz, Lauryn Hill, Grace Jones to Headline AfroPunk NYC |magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/news/lenny-kravitz-lauryn-hill-grace-jones-to-headline-afropunk-nyc-20150602 |accessdate=September 21, 2015 }}</ref> }}
==See also== * [[Afro-punk]] * [[James Spooner]] * [[Afro-Punk (film)]]
==References== {{reflist}}

revision.text:
'''Bakitone International''' is a non-profit organization based in Athens, Greece that maintains a network of almost 1000 international classical [[music competitions]] around the world. Bakitone International represents interests of [[European Broadcasting Union]] members at the international level in the field of classical music since 2010. It was founded in 2008 as a promotional agency for musicians in order to assist them in selecting from the database of music competitions and master-classes to achieve their career goals.
In 2009 Bakitone International has opened branches in [[Moscow, Russia]], [[Shanghai, China]] and [[Los Angeles, USA]]. The organization has quickly earned international acclaim amongst young artists, as well as famous musicians, such as [[Vladimir Ashkenazy]], [[Daniel Pollack]] and [[Yuri Bashmet]]. In 2009 Bakitone was featured on [[TV Kultura]]<ref>http://www.progressiverockvideos.com/video/9Bw1Hh_IVlQ/Bakitone-featured-on-TV-Kultura-Russia.html {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100928035805/http://www.progressiverockvideos.com/video/9Bw1Hh_IVlQ/Bakitone-featured-on-TV-Kultura-Russia.html |date=September 28, 2010 }}</ref> channel and Newsland <ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.newsland.ru/News/Detail/id/421245/cat/69| title=Появился поисковик для музыкальных конкурсов (Search engine for music competitions) | publisher=Newsland | date=Oct 9, 2009 | accessdate=September 16, 2012}}</ref> channel in Russia, dedicated to classical music and arts. In 2010 the organization published a magazine in Russia featuring interviews with [[Daniel Pollack]] and [[Yuri Bashmet]].
In September 2010, Bakitone International has established a special award for the best performance at ''The Muse International Piano Competition'' <ref>http://themuse.gr/competition/Results_Junior_2010.html</ref> in [[Athens, Greece]]. The Prize was awarded to a 5-year old prodigy violinist Dunja Kalamir from Serbia.
== References == <!--- See [[Wikipedia:Footnotes]] on how to create references using <ref></ref> tags which will then appear here automatically --> {{Reflist}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox motorsport championship | logo = BaTCC final-2-1.jpg | caption = | category = [[Touring car racing|Touring cars]] | country/region = [[Baltic States]] | inaugural = 2000 | folded = | drivers = | teams = | constructors = | engines = | tyres =[[Hankook]] |tires=|champion driver={{flagicon|LAT}} BGT [[Pavel Shchapov]]
{{flagicon|RUS}} BTC1 [[Pavel Yushin]]
{{flagicon|LIT}} BTC 2 [[Ernesta Globyte]]
{{flagicon|LAT}} National [[Jānis Vanks]]
{{flagicon|EST}} S1600 [[Steven Puust]]| champion team = {{flagicon|LIT}} [[Skuba Dream]] | manufacturer = | website = http://www.batcc.eu | current_season = | pixels = }}
The '''Baltic Touring Car Championship''' or '''BaTCC''' is a [[touring car racing]] series held each year in the [[Baltic states]]. The championship is regulated by a board containing two representatives each from the automobile associations of [[Estonia]], [[Latvia]] and [[Lithuania]]. Eligible cars for the championship have often changed over recent years. In 2018 there are class entries for BTC1, BTC2, Baltic GT, [[Super 1600]], National Cars.
Drivers from the BaTCC with Super Production and Super 1600 cars are eligible to enter the [[Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile|FIA]] [[European Touring Car Cup]]<ref>http://www.fiaetcc.com/2k8/ {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711000150/http://www.fiaetcc.com/2k8/ |date=2011-07-11 }} Invited national championships</ref>
Races are held in race tracks in Baltic States. [[Auto24ring]] in Estonia, Biķernieki in Latvia, [[Nemuno Žiedas|Nemuno Ziedas]] in Lithuania.
The race day format features two races per round, with standing starts for [[Legends car racing|Legends]] and Touring cars and rolling start for [[Grand Touring|GT]] cars. There were a total of five rounds in 2017, with three rounds each at Riga and one in Parnu and Palanga.
BaTCC championship is held together with [[Baltic Endurance Championship]] or BEC 4H. Teams participate in 4 hour endurance races in different racing categories.
Cars used are often [[BMW M3]], [[Honda Civic]]s, [[Volkswagen Golf|VW Golf]], [[Opel Astra]] and others.
==Racing classes==
The following shows the key specifications issues for each class. BTC and Hankook Trophy category have two 10 lap races per event. While BEC Championship has one 4 hour race per event.
===BTC===
'''BTC1''' cars with engine capacity from 1798cm3 to 2800cm3.
'''BTC2''' cars with engine capacity from 2800cm3 to 4500cm3. Class BTC2 maximum engine capacity is allowed 4500cm3 which includes all the ratios of the Technical Regulations. (Example: 2000cm3 bi-turbo engine has a ratio 2,2 which means actual engine capacity would equal 4400 cm3). Maximum 6 cylinder engines are allowed in class BTC2.
'''BGT''' or Baltic GT class is meant for FIA GT3 and GT4 cars (with present or expired FIA homologation) and all touring cars which are not in conformity with requirements of the classes BTC1 and BTC2. Cars which do not have FIA homologation approved weights should use ratio table from the Technical Regulations for Baltic Touring Cars. Minimum engine capacity (including all ratios) is set to be 1998 cm3.
===Hankook Trophy===
Hankook Trophy uses Hankook Z222 195/50R15 racing tyre model.
'''Super 1600''' category shall be open for all cars that have been or are in serialproduction with maximum cylinder capacity of 1640 cm3 and one driving axle.
'''National Class''' category is open for cars with stock engines and gearboxes. Class is divided into 2 divisions - up to 170 BHP and up to 210 BHP.
===Baltic Endurance Championship===
'''A2000''' Racing cars with engine capacity up to 2000 cm3
'''A3000''' Racing cars with engine capacity up to 3000 cm3
'''A3000+''' Racing cars with engine capacity over 3000 cm3
'''GT''' Racing cars with 6 or less cylinder engines and/or theoretical engine capacity over 4500 cm3, all racing cars that used to be and still are certified by FIA as GT and SRO cars. Also, all cars that meet GT class philosophy, however, were not made for racing according to FIA, for example, when road car is remade to racing vehicle (Porsche, Ferrari, etc.)
'''X1''' Experimental (exclusive) racing cars, also, cars made according to experimental producible cars (with tubular or frame type bodies or any other exclusive aspects).
'''D1''' Diesel cars.

2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thestate.com/2013/01/03/2576708/activists-at-least-9-killed-by.html#.UOZl12_7JCg|title=Rebel area shows limits of rebel push for Damascus|publisher=|accessdate=25 February 2013}} * Rebel offensive repelled * Four senior government officials killed in a [[18 July 2012 Damascus bombing|bombing attack]] * Sporadic insurgent attacks continue leading to [[Rif Several local Palestinian militias{{cite web|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2012/Jul-18/181033-palestinians-join-syria-revolt-activists-fsa.ashx#axzz2Aniktc00 |title=Palestinians join Syria revolt: activists, FSA|work=The Daily Star |date=18 July 2012 |accessdate=31 October 2012}} |units2 = [[3rd Armoured Division (Syria)|3rd Armoured Division]]

Elements of other divisions |strength1 = 2,500–5,000{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/rebels-start-ops-to-free-damascus-assad-sends-in-helicopters-tanks/976028/|title=Rebels start ops to free Damascus, Assad sends in helicopters, tanks|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}}{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/world/5000-rebel-fighters-heading-to-damascus-to-topple-bashar-alassad-7958704.html|title=5,000 rebel fighters 'heading to Damascus to topple Bashar al-Assad'|work=The Evening Standard|accessdate=25 October 2014}} fighters (start of the battle) *1,500 Idlib fighters{{cite news|url=http://world.time.com/2012/07/18/in-syria-rebels-celebrate-stunning-assassinations-and-send-more-forces-to-damascus/|title=In Syria, Rebels Celebrate Stunning Assassinations–and Send More Forces to Damascus|work=TIME.com|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=18 July 2012}} 800 fighters (time of the Tadamoun battle) |strength2 = 178,000 total strength{{cite web|url=http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/MS.MIL.TOTL.P1|title=Armed forces personnel, total|publisher=}} |casualties1 =300 killed,{{cite news|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/assad-masses-tanks-for-decisive-battle-in-aleppo/story-e6frg6so-1226437889732|title=Assad masses tanks for decisive battle in Aleppo|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014|work=The Australian|date=29 July 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/syrian-army-declares-al-tadamun-damascus-district-free-insurgency|title=Syrian army declares Al Tadamun in Damascus district as 'free of insurgency'|work=Al Jazeera Blogs|accessdate=25 October 2014}}
hundreds captured
14 vehicles destroyed
(government claim) |casualties2 = 92–97 killed*65 [http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/07/18/227037.html] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120719153650/http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/07/18/227037.html# |date=19 July 2012 }}-70 [http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2012/7/17/worldupdates/2012-07-17T131724Z_35_BRE8640R3_RTROPTT_0_UK-SYRIA-CRISIS&sec=Worldupdates]{{dead link|date=July 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} killed (16–17 July), 4 killed (18 July),[https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18920733] 23 killed (19 July),[http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=420980]{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} total of 92-97 reported killed
130 wounded,
3 tanks and 1 [[Armored car (military)|AV]] destroyed
1 AV captured
3 [[Mil Mi-8]] helicopters shot down
300 killed (opposition claim) |casualties3 =140+ civilians killed{{cite web|url=http://supportkurds.org/sks/syrian-revolution/|archive-url=https://wayback.archive-it.org/all/20131122193727/http://supportkurds.org/sks/syrian-revolution/|dead-url=yes|archive-date=22 November 2013|title=Support Kurds in Syria|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014|df=dmy-all}} |notes =*Figures updated to 19 July | campaignbox = {{Campaignbox Syrian civil war}} {{Campaignbox Rif Dimashq Campaign}} }} The '''Battle of Damascus''' ({{lang-ar|معركة دمشق}}), also known as '''Operation Damascus Volcano''' ({{lang-ar|عملية بركان دمشق}}), started on 15 July 2012 during the [[Syrian Civil War]]. It is unclear who started the battle. Thousands of rebels infiltrated [[Damascus]] from the surrounding countryside. Following this, according to some reports, the opposition forces launched an operation to capture the capital, while according to other reports, the military learned of the large-scale rebel operation beforehand and made a preemptive strike. Some reports even suggested the rebels launched the operation prematurely due to their plans being discovered by the security forces. After the rebels initially captured half a dozen districts and killed four high-ranking government ministers in a bombing, opposition forces were forced to retreat following a military counter-attack, leaving the army in control of the capital after three weeks of fighting. It was the first time tanks and helicopters had been deployed in central Damascus and left parts of the city as a warzone. ==Battle== ===Operation Damascus Volcano=== [[File:Operation Damascus Volcano (2012).svg|thumb|left|Attack routes of the [[Free Syrian Army]] during ''Operation Damascus Volcano'' ]] On 15 July, fierce fighting was reported in some quarters of central Damascus as the army moved in to dislodge rebels. The rebels fighting were the ones who were routed from Douma and other suburbs and fled to Damascus itself. Fighting also closed the road leading from central Damascus to airport.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jul/16/syria-fighting-damascus-live?CMP=twt_gu|title=Guardian live updates|author=Haroon Siddique|work=the Guardian|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|date=17 July 2012}} The rebels were also on the offensive, attacking the Hajar al-Aswad district.{{cite news|url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2012-07-20/business/sns-rt-us-syria-crisis-damascusbre86j17e-20120720_1_midan-southern-hajar-al-aswad-district-assad|title=How "Damascus Volcano" erupted in Assad's stronghold|work=Chicago Tribune|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=20 July 2012}} On 16 July, for a second day, heavy clashes in the southern Midan and Tadhamon districts of Damascus raged{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18859453|title=Syria unrest: Second day of fierce Damascus clashes|work=BBC News|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=16 July 2012}} with the military managing to surround the rebel forces in the area and sending tanks and other armored vehicles into the neighborhoods. The FSA had reportedly taken control of the two districts earlier and the military was making attempts to overrun it.{{cite web|url=http://www.skynews.com.au/topstories/article.aspx?id=772508|title=Damascus fighting a 'turning point'|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} The rebels called the clashes a raid by them against the capital,{{cite news|url=http://ca.reuters.com/article/topNews/idCABRE8610SH20120716|title=Syrian forces surround rebels fighting in capital|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014|work=Reuters|date=16 July 2012}} while the government called it a 48-hour military operation to clear the area of any opposition forces. There were also indications that the government knew about the planned rebel raid and acted on the information. According to state TV, the military killed over 80 rebel fighters during the fighting.{{cite web|url=http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/721521.shtml |title=Syrian capital's clashes continue in southern part |publisher= |accessdate=25 October 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130728161937/http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/721521.shtml |archivedate=28 July 2013 |df=dmy }} On 17 July, shooting was reported in one of the main central streets and machine-gun fire was reported in nearby [[Sabaa Bahrat Square (Damascus)|Sabaa Bahrat Square]], site of the [[Central Bank of Syria]], which was the scene of several major [[Syrian civil war#Rallies in support of the Assad government|pro-government demonstrations]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18866265|title=Syria conflict: Central Damascus hit by clashes|work=BBC News|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=17 July 2012}} A brief firefight also erupted near the Syrian parliament building.{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/story/2012/07/17/syria-damascus-fighting.html|title=Damascus sees heavy fighting, activists say|date=17 July 2012|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014|work=CBC News}} Fighting was ongoing in the southern Midan and Kfar Sousa districts and the northern Barzeh and [[Qaboun]] districts. Artillery shelling was reported in all of them and specifically in Midan it was reported to be "hysterical", according to activists. At the same time, in Barzeh and Qaboun, helicopter rocket strikes were reported. Later, helicopter strikes were reportedly hitting all four neighborhoods.{{cite web|url=http://www.rferl.org/content/syria-damascus-fighting-escalates-defections-continue/24647884.html|title=Syrian Regime Uses Attack Helicopters In Damascus; Defections Continue|work=RadioFreeEurope/RadioLiberty|accessdate=25 October 2014}} The state-run news agency reported that rebel forces had retreated from the Nahr Aisha district to Midan, where fighting was continuing.{{cite web|url=http://www.kcautv.com/story/19047105/clashes-spread-to-new-areas-in-syrian-capital|title=Siouxland church creates buzz surrounding bees found in sanctuary|author=Bria Bell|work=SIOUXLANDMATTERS}} Army reinforcements were sent from the Golan Heights to help defend the capital.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jul/17/syria-crisis-damascus-clashes-live#block-20|title=3.20pm: Syria|author=Matthew Weaver|work=the Guardian|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|date=17 July 2012}} This was confirmed by Israeli army intelligence. "The Syrian military is acting very brutally, which shows the regime is desperate. Its control of Damascus is getting weaker," Major General [[Aviv Kochavi]] told a parliamentary committee in Israel. The rebels claimed to have killed 70 soldiers and pro-government militiamen in the previous two days of clashes,{{cite web|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2012/7/17/worldupdates/2012-07-17T131724Z_35_BRE8640R3_RTROPTT_0_UK-SYRIA-CRISIS&sec=Worldupdates|title=Syria fighting rages in capital, Russia pressed|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}}{{dead link|date=July 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} while the government reported 14 rebel vehicles were destroyed{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2012/07/17/world/meast/syria-unrest/index.html|title=Syrian soldiers jump through flaming hoops as helicopters fly over capital|date=17 July 2012|work=CNN|accessdate=25 October 2014}} and an army officer stated that they killed 33 rebels, wounded 15 and captured 145 in the day's fighting in the Qaboun area, where the majority of opposition forces were reportedly.[https://archive.is/20130112100323/http://news.kuwaittimes.net/2012/07/17/syrian-rebels-battling-to-liberate-damascus/ Syrian rebels battling to ‘liberate’ Damascus] An activist, Shakeeb al-Jabri, claimed that more than 200 soldiers had been killed or wounded in total. A deputy police chief, Brigadier General Issa Duba, was said to have died from wounds sustained during the clashes, according to a pro-Assad website.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jul/17/syria-crisis-damascus-clashes-live#block-8|title=11.09am: Syria|author=Matthew Weaver|work=the Guardian|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|date=17 July 2012}} The FSA stated they destroyed one armored vehicle and captured another and that, among the members of the Syrian military who were killed, were several rooftop snipers.{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/assad-loses-grip-on-damascus-as-rebels-begin-to-close-in-on-regime-7946872.html|title=Assad loses grip on Damascus as rebels begin to close in on regime|work=The Independent|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|first=Loveday|last=Morris|date=17 July 2012}}{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jul/17/syria-crisis-damascus-clashes-live#block-22|title=4.23pm: Syria|author=Matthew Weaver|work=the Guardian|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|date=17 July 2012}} The opposition also claimed to have shot down an army helicopter in the Qaboun district.{{cite web|url=http://www.firstpost.com/world/syrian-rebels-converge-on-capital-russia-pressed-380992.html|title=Syrian rebels converge on capital, Russia pressed|author=FP Staff|date=17 July 2012|work=Firstpost}} There were contradictions among the rebels themselves on the nature of the conflict. One FSA commander declared that the "battle for liberation of Damascus had begun".{{cite web|url=http://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/41304/iraq-calls-on-citizens-in-syria-to-return-home|title=FSA: 'Battle for liberation' of Damascus has begun|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} The FSA dubbed their assault ''Operation Damascus Volcano''. But Tarek, the rebel spokesman in Damascus, stated the clashes were still only skirmishes. He also said the FSA didn't start the battle, which would be in line with earlier reports that the military made a preemptive strike on the opposition forces, after learning of their plan for the attack on the capital.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jul/17/syria-crisis-damascus-clashes-live#block-14|title=1.44pm: Syria|author=Matthew Weaver|work=the Guardian|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|date=17 July 2012}} Government Information Minister Omran Zoabi stated that the military confronted rebel forces who infiltrated the city, surrounded them and forced many to retreat, while the rest were still being dealt with. RT reporter Maria Finoshina stated that fighting was nowhere near the level she experienced during the government assault on the suburb of Douma the previous week. She said that except for continuing occasional gunfire and military patrols “it doesn't seem like final or decisive battle for the capital".{{cite web|url=http://www.rt.com/news/syria-damascus-shooting-finoshina-367/|title=Scattered gun fights sound ‘Battle for Damascus’ (VIDEO)|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} Several videos of the fighting in the capital emerged during the day.{{cite news|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/world_now/2012/07/syrian-capital-struck-with-fiercest-fighting-reported-yet-video.html|title=Syrian capital, Damascus, hit with fiercest fighting yet [Video]|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014|work=Los Angeles Times|date=17 July 2012}}{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jul/17/syrian-armed-rebels-fight-damascus|title=Syrian armed rebels take fight to government troops in Damascus|author=Ian Black|work=the Guardian|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|date=17 July 2012}} ===Damascus bombing=== {{main|2012 Damascus bombing}} On 18 July, Syrian state TV reported that a suicide attack that targeted National Security headquarters in Damascus killed Syrian defense minister General [[Daoud Rajha]] during a meeting of ministers and a number of heads of security agencies. Many other VIPs were wounded and killed in the attack as well. Also killed were [[Assef Shawkat]], Bashar al-Assad's brother-in-law and deputy defense minister,{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4257338,00.html|title=Syrian TV confirms Assef Shawkat was killed in bombing|work=ynet|accessdate=25 October 2014}} the assistant to the vice president general Hassan Turkomani{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/07/20127189355415804.html|title=Syria blast strikes at heart of Assad's rule|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}}{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18889030|title=Profiles of Syria officials Asef Shawkat, Daoud Rajiha and Hassan Turkomani|work=BBC News|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=20 July 2012}} and Hafez Makhlouf, head of investigations at the Syrian Intelligence Agency.{{cite web|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/07/18/227035.html|title=Bomb kills Syria defense minister, Assad’s brother-in-law and key aides|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120719080452/http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/07/18/227035.html#|archive-date=19 July 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} The country's intelligence chief [[Hisham Bekhityar]] was seriously wounded.{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/syrian-defense-minister-killed-in-damascus-blast-as-fighting-comes-within-sight-of-assad-s-palace-1.451946|title=Syrian defense minister killed in Damascus blast, as fighting comes within sight of Assad's palace|date=18 July 2012|work=Haaretz.com|accessdate=25 October 2014}} There were conflicting reports on the fate of the Interior minister [[Mohammad Ibrahim al-Shaar]] with initial accounts stating that he had also been killed, but later state TV reported that he survived although wounded.{{cite web|url=https://foreignpolicy.com/articles/2012/07/18/the_end_of_the_political_solution|title=The End of the Political Solution|date=18 July 2012|work=Foreign Policy|accessdate=25 October 2014}} Additional reports stated that he was in stable condition.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-07-19/middle-east/32746336_1_assad-state-tv-suicide-blast|title=Assad's top three aides killed in blast|work=The Times of India|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=19 July 2012}} The bomber was reportedly a bodyguard of one of the meeting attendant.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/07/18/us-syria-crisis-bomber-idUSBRE86H0G620120718|title=Damascus bomber was bodyguard for Assad's inner circle: Syrian security source|work=Reuters|accessdate=25 October 2014|first=Samia|last=Nakhoul|date=18 July 2012}} The opposition meanwhile claimed that the cause of the explosion was not a suicide bomber, but that a rebel insider planted bombs inside of the building and detonated it remotely from a distant location.{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-202_162-57474510/syria-defense-minister-gen-dawoud-rajha-reportedly-killed-in-explosion-in-damascus/|title=Syria Defense Minister Gen. Dawoud Rajha killed in explosion in Damascus|date=18 July 2012|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014|work=CBS News}} Also, during the night, residents reported that an army barracks near the [[Presidential Palace, Damascus|Presidential Palace]], about a hundred meters from the presidential palace itself, came under heavy fire with residents posting video showing a fire, but no explosions were heard. Earlier in the day, SANA stated that government troops were pushing into the Midan district. At the same time, SOHR relayed that the Barzeh and Qaboun districts were under helicopter attack.{{cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/syrian-defense-minister-dawoud-rajha-killed-suicide-blast-senior-officials-wounded-article-1.1116739|title=Syrian defense minister Dawoud Rajha killed in suicide blast, other senior officials wounded|work=NY Daily News|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=New York|date=18 July 2012}} Fighting was also reported in the Kfar Souseh and Nahr Aisha districts.{{cite web|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/syria-rebels-government-forces-battle-in-damascus/1/208855.html|title=Syrian rebels, government forces battle in Damascus|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} After the bombing, the Free Syrian Army claimed that army troops had withdrawn from the Midan district. However, less than an hour later, state TV claimed to be broadcasting live footage of clashes in the neighborhood. According to Al-Jazeera, the military shelled the district. Early in the evening, opposition activists reported that Midan was raided by the military. The FSA meanwhile moved its troops to the al-Sabina area.{{cite web|url=http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=253828|title=NOW Lebanon - NOW Syria 18.7.2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120906140521/http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=253828|archivedate=6 September 2012|df=dmy-all}} Residents in the Barzeh district, where rebels were holding out earlier, reported that only government troops were to be found in the neighborhood's streets.{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/07/18/fighting-rages-in-damascu_n_1682564.html|title=Damascus Fighting Rages On After Deadly Bomb Attack|date=18 July 2012|work=The Huffington Post|accessdate=25 October 2014}} Opposition activists claimed that Syrian army commander Mohammad al-Bardan defected to the rebel side along with his soldiers and Al Arabiya reported that soldiers from 3rd Armored Division were withdrawing from several Damascus districts and leaving their tanks behind following the bombing.{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4257524,00.html|title=Celebrations, defections follow Damascus blast|work=ynet|accessdate=25 October 2014}} However, this was not independently confirmed or relayed by other news media. Reuters reported that the Syrian Army escalated its response to the bombing by firing on suburbs from artillery batteries located on a mountain overlooking Damascus.{{cite web|url=http://www.todayszaman.com/newsDetail_getNewsById.action?newsId=286976|title=ZAMAN|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120718235123/http://www.todayszaman.com/newsDetail_getNewsById.action?newsId=286976|archivedate=18 July 2012|df=dmy-all}} Al Jazeera meanwhile reported that FSA was able to shoot down two helicopters that had been shelling Tadamon and Al-Hajjar al-Aswad districts. As before, this report could not be independently verified due to restrictions placed on the journalists. A monitoring group, SOHR, reported that 60 soldiers had been killed on the third and fourth day of fighting.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/07/20127189355415804.html|title=Damascus blast 'kills' top Assad officials|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} The security forces gave residents 48 hours to flee the fighting area. One military source told that the army exercised restraint in its response in Damascus but that after the bombing, they would use all their weapons to finish the rebels.{{cite web|url=http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=420619|title=Hundreds flee Damascus fighting, NGO says|date=10 August 2012|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120721070021/http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=420619#|archive-date=21 July 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} ===Military counter-attack=== [[File:Damascus Checkpoint.jpeg|thumb|Syrian soldier manning a checkpoint with a [[PK machine gun]]]] On 19 July, the military launched an offensive to push back rebel forces that infiltrated Damascus.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18897773|title=Syria conflict: Fresh offensive against rebels|work=BBC News|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=19 July 2012}} Damascus residents reported ongoing shelling of several districts, including Midan and Kafr Souseh. Residents were meanwhile arming themselves, with many citizens fleeing districts which were hit by ongoing battles. The army removed its checkpoints around Midan district and the ancient Old City for reasons unknown.{{cite news|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2012/07/19/uk-syria-crisis-idUKBRE86H18C20120719|title=Rebels keep pressure on Assad, fight near government buildings|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014|work=Reuters|date=19 July 2012}} Afterwards, opposition groups accused the Syrian army in massacring 100 civilians that had been shot and killed by security forces gunfire during a funeral procession in al-Sayida Zainab on the outskirts of Damascus. However, later reports by opposition groups revised the toll to at least 60. Meanwhile, the FSA reportedly shelled [[Damascus International Airport]] with mortars 20 times.{{cite web|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/07/19/227178.html|title=Around 100 Syrians in a mass funeral killed by Assad regime: opposition group|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131216184209/http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/07/19/227178.html#|archive-date=16 December 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} It was reported that the president, [[Bashar al-Assad]], was in the coastal city of Latakia, directing the fighting in Damascus. However, it was unclear if he traveled there from Damascus before or after the bombing attack. One opposition official stated that they had information he may have been in Latakia for days. Meanwhile, following the Damascus bombing, his mother and sister went to Tartus.{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/syria/9412126/Syria-Bashar-al-Assad-flees-to-Latakia.html|title=Syria: Bashar al-Assad 'flees to Latakia'|date=19 July 2012|work=Telegraph.co.uk|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|first=Damien|last=McElroy}} Also, rumors circulated around Damascus that al-Assad's wife, Asma, had gone to Russia.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2175871/Syria-Bashar-al-Assad-wife-Asma-escape-Russia-assassination-dictators-generals.html#ixzz2169n8vQG|title=Is this the end game for Assad? Syrian dictator flees to coast and his British-born wife 'escapes to Russia'|work=Mail Online|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|first=Rob|last=Preece|date=19 July 2012}} During the day, al-Assad was shown on state TV attending the swearing-in of his new defense minister.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18914578|title=Syria conflict: West 'appalled' by Russia China UN veto|work=BBC News|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=19 July 2012}}[http://www.seattlepi.com/news/article/First-sign-of-Syria-s-Assad-emerges-after-attack-3718448.php First sign of Syria's Assad emerges after attack] An activist based in the eastern Damascus district Mezze said in interview with [[The Guardian]] that rebels had taken control over the Midan and Qaboun districts with fighting raging in Kafr Souseh and Mezze. He also claimed three tanks were destroyed in Kafr Souseh by the FSA.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/middle-east-live/2012/jul/19/syria-crisis-aftermath-damascus-assassinations-live#block-25|title=The Guardian Middle East Live Blog 19.7.2012|author=Matthew Weaver|work=the Guardian|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|date=19 July 2012}} Later that day, the Syrian Army stormed the Qaboun district with a large number of tanks, according to the opposition group Syrian Observatory, who said the army's move stoked fears of an imminent massacre in the area. Earlier, rebels attacked the central police command in Old Damascus, killing five officers.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/07/201271961645358140.html|title=Syria tanks storm Damascus district|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} That night, Syrian State TV broadcast footage of Qaboun, showing the corpses of about 20 dead rebels.{{cite web|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2012/7/20/worldupdates/2012-07-20T125812Z_24_BRE86H18C_RTROPTT_0_UK-SYRIA-CRISIS&sec=Worldupdates|title=Syrian forces stretched, intelligence chief dies|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cLct3RBc7gE|title=2012 7 19|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} The opposition group, Syrian Observatory, said that 23 rebels and 47 alleged civilians were killed in Damascus during the day.{{cite web|url=http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=420980|title=Over 300 dead in Syria Thursday; highest toll of revolt, activists say|date=10 August 2012|publisher=}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The following day, security sources told AFP that the Army had launched a general offensive in Damascus.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/liveblog/topic/syria-153|title=Syria's Civil War|publisher=}} The Syrian Army continued its counter-attack, storming the quarter of Jobar in Damascus, searching for rebels.{{cite web|url=http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=421002|title=Syrian regime forces storm Jobar area of Damascus, activists say|date=10 August 2012|publisher=}} The Syrian official press agency stated that the army inflicted heavy losses on the rebels in Qaboun and that the Syrian Army regained control of Midan.{{cite web|url=http://en.trend.az/regions/met/arabicr/2048607.html|title=Syrian troops clash with armed rebels in Qaboun district of capital|date=20 July 2012|work=Trend.Az}} The rebels confirmed this stating they had been forced to withdraw from Midan after the army assault.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18920733|title=Syria attack: Security chief Ikhtiar dies from wounds|work=BBC News|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=20 July 2012}}{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/21/world/middleeast/clashes-continue-after-border-posts-fall-to-syrian-rebels.html|title=U.N. Extends Syria Mission as Violence Rises to New Heights|date=21 July 2012|work=The New York Times}}{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/middle-east-live/2012/jul/20/syria-crisis-rebels-seize-borders-live#block-16 | location=London | work=The Guardian | first1=Matthew | last1=Weaver | first2=Brian | last2=Whitaker | title=Syria crisis: UN mission given 30 day extension - Friday 20 July 2012 | date=20 July 2012}} Rebel fighters stormed and burned the Sa'iqa military camp, which was being used as a training facility, in the Basateen al-Mezzeh district in central Damascus according to activists.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/syrian-rebels-storm-military-camp-damascus-district|title=Syrian rebels storm military camp in Damascus district|work=Al Jazeera Blogs|accessdate=25 October 2014}} At the end of 20 July, Damascus center and areas beyond were reported to be under firm government control with some fighting continuing only in the outskirts.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/middle-east-live/2012/jul/20/syria-crisis-rebels-seize-borders-live#block-28|title=3.22pm|author=Matthew Weaver|work=the Guardian|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|date=20 July 2012}} The rebels who were fighting near the Yarbouk camp were overrun by the Army and the Palestinian factions loyal to the government.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/middle-east-live/2012/jul/20/syria-crisis-rebels-seize-borders-live#block-34|title=4.27pm|author=Matthew Weaver|work=the Guardian|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|date=20 July 2012}} On 21 July, a security source told AFP that the Army took control of Tadamon, Qaboun and Barzeh, in addition to Midan, the previous day, but that fighting was still ongoing in the Jobar, Kfar Sousa and Mazeeh quarters. It was later confirmed that Barzeh was still rebel-held.[https://archive.is/20121209104610/http://www.thejakartaglobe.com/afp/syrian-forces-launch-all-out-damascus-assault/531828 Syrian forces launch all-out Damascus assault | The Jakarta Globe] Activists claimed that fighting was still reported in Damascus proper, with clashes in the northern Barzeh and Rukneddine districts and that a police station was attacked on Khaled bin Waleed street, with an activist saying rebels in Damascus were staging hit-and-run attacks as opposed to controlling areas.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/07/2012720142235155363.html|title=Syria strikes back at rebels in Damascus|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} Still, during the morning, the city was largely calm according to residents. SOHR said the military bombarded the Al-Kaddam and Assali neighborhoods of Damascus. Residents also reported fighting in the Al-Hajar Al-Aswad and Tadamon districts.{{Cite web |url=http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=421278# |title=Lebanon news - NOW Lebanon -Clashes in Syria's Aleppo, tense calm in Damascus |access-date=21 July 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120724094518/http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=421278# |archive-date=24 July 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} Undated online video posted by activists appeared to show the local police station being overrun at Yarmouk and clashes were reported in the Northern suburb of al-Tal, where the head of the local Political Security Directorate (PSD) branch and all his staff reportedly surrendered to FSA fighters.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18937514|title=Syria crisis: Heavy clashes in second city of Aleppo|work=BBC News|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=22 July 2012}} 12 civilians were reported killed during the day, seven of them by sniper fire.{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/2/8/48346/World/Region/At-least--killed-in-Syria-Saturday-Rights-group.aspx|title=At least 90 killed in Syria Saturday: Rights group|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} However, Reuters confirmed that the city was calm and that the police checkpoints which had been abandoned during the fighting were back.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/07/21/us-syria-crisis-idUSBRE8610SH20120721|title=Syrian forces battle rebels in Aleppo, families flee|work=Reuters|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=21 July 2012}} During the day, Brig. Gen. Nabil Zougheib, a Christian, was assassinated along with his wife and two sons.{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052702303644004577524653025270434|title=Syrian Conflict Draws In Christians|date=23 July 2012|work=WSJ|accessdate=25 October 2014|first=Sam|last=Dagher}} Islamist radicals from the [[Wahhabism|Wahhabist]] rebel group [[Jaysh al-Islam|Brigade of Islam]] claimed responsible for the killings. Islamist fighters from the [[Muslim Brotherhood of Syria|Muslim Brotherhood]] also reportedly attacked Iraqi refugees in the southeastern part of the city.{{cite web|url=http://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/islamists-attack-christians-iraqi-refugees-in-damascus/|title=Islamists attack Christians, Iraqi refugees in Damascus|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} On 22 July, fierce fighting was reported along with intense shelling by reporters. Activists said that helicopter gunships fired rockets into a southern Damascus neighbourhood.{{cite web|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/07/22/227667.html|title=Fierce fighting in Damascus, Ban Ki-Moon sending peacekeeping chief to Syria|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141025181546/http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/07/22/227667.html#|archive-date=25 October 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} A journalist reported that helicopters were also shelling Barzeh.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/damascus-neighbourhood-shelled-helicopter-gunships|title=Damascus neighbourhood shelled by 'helicopter gunships'.|work=Al Jazeera Blogs|accessdate=25 October 2014}} Later, the Syrian Army led by the Fourth division stormed the district of Barzeh.{{cite web|url=http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=421469&MID=149&PID=2|title=Feared forces launch new assault on Damascus|date=22 July 2012|publisher=}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite news| url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/07/22/us-syria-crisis-fighting-idUSBRE86L03F20120722 | work=Reuters | title=Syria government forces, rebels battle in Damascus, Aleppo | date=22 July 2012}} The Fourth division also routed the rebels out of Mezzeh{{cite web|url=http://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/42084/protesters-damage-hafez-assads-statue-shelling-res|title=Syrian army overruns Damascus as Turkey deploys missiles on Syria border|date=22 July 2012|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.rt.com/news/syria-helicopters-bomb-damascus-780/|title=Govt helicopters bombing Damascus districts not confirmed|work=RT International}} after 1,000 troops entered the district backed-up by armoured vehicles, tanks and bulldozers.{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/syria/9418993/Syria-Assad-regime-retakes-control-of-Damascus-suburbs.html|title=Syria: Assad regime retakes control of Damascus suburbs|date=22 July 2012|work=Telegraph.co.uk|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|first=Adrian|last=Blomfield}} The military continued their advance by forcing the rebels to withdraw from Rukn al-Din.{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18943316 | work=BBC News | title=Syria troops hit back at rebels in Damascus and Aleppo | date=23 July 2012}} State media reported that the soldiers were pursuing the last remnants of the rebels.{{cite news| url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/07/22/us-syria-crisis-idUSBRE8610SH20120722 | work=Reuters | title=Syrian forces bombard Damascus, fight rages in Aleppo | date=22 July 2012}} By the end of the day, activists confirmed that Barzeh was also overrun by government troops and that at least five young men, possibly rebels, were summarily executed.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/syrian-army-forces-overrun-northern-damascus-district-barzeh-and-summarily-execute-five|title=Syrian Army Forces overrun northern Damascus district of Barzeh and summarily execute five young men|work=Al Jazeera Blogs|accessdate=25 October 2014}} The rebel operation to capture Damascus seemed close to collapse according to a journalist{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/syria/9418601/Syrian-troops-driving-rebels-out-of-Damascus-strongholds.html|title=Syrian troops driving rebels out of Damascus strongholds|date=22 July 2012|work=Telegraph.co.uk|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|first=Adrian|last=Blomfield}} and activists reported that army soldiers executed at least 20 unarmed men in Mezzeh that they suspected of aiding rebels.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/07/201272275230449605.html|title=Syria army launches fierce attacks on rebels|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} Syrian State media showed graphic images of foreign Arab fighters killed in Qaboun, including two Egyptians and three Jordanians, identified by their identity papers.{{cite web|url=http://sana.sy/eng/337/2012/07/24/432866.htm|title=Syrian TV Shows Bodies of Terrorists of Arab Nationalities Killed by the Syrian Army in al-Qaboun Neighborhood|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121031032322/http://sana.sy/eng/337/2012/07/24/432866.htm#|archive-date=31 October 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} The next day, the bodies of 23 people, who were reportedly "executed" in Mezze and Barzeh, were found, some of which had torture marks.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/least-23-summarily-executed-sunday|title=At least 23 "summarily executed" on Sunday|work=Al Jazeera Blogs|accessdate=25 October 2014}} Meanwhile, the Israeli military confirmed that president Assad, along with his family, was still in the capital, contradicting earlier reports that they left the city for Latakia.{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/syrian-forces-bombard-damascus-idf-says-assad-still-in-capital-1.452823|title=Syrian forces bombard Damascus; IDF says Assad still in capital|date=22 July 2012|work=Haaretz.com|accessdate=25 October 2014}} ===FSA retreat=== On 23 July, the government declared most of the rebel forces that attacked the capital to be defeated.{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/07/23/syria-conflict-damascus_n_1695623.html|title=Syria Conflict: Damascus Suffers Destruction, Hunger As Fighting Hits Country's Heart|date=23 July 2012|work=The Huffington Post|accessdate=25 October 2014}} An opposition activist confirmed this by saying that government troops had taken control of almost all of the capital.{{cite web|url=http://www.naharnet.com/stories/en/47542-syrian-army-retakes-most-of-damascus|title=Syrian Army Retakes Most of Damascus|work=Naharnet|accessdate=25 October 2014}} Following this, there were disagreements between rebel commanders about the opportunity of having launched the Damascus battle as rebel colonel [[Riad al-Asaad]] disagreed with rebel colonel Qasem Saadedine who started the operation.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/middle-east-live/2012/jul/23/syria-damascus-aleppo-battles-live#block-10|title=Syria crisis: chemical weapon warning - 23 July 2012|author=Matthew Weaver|work=the Guardian|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|date=23 July 2012}} The opposition activist group SOHR stated that 94 people were killed during the previous two days of fighting.[http://www.charlotteobserver.com/2012/07/23/3400914/fighting-in-syria-indicates-bashar.html Fighting in Syria indicates Bashar Assad's end isn't imminent]{{dead link|date=October 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} A man claiming to be a civilian from Midan said "Midan is back to normal. There were some militias who tried to control the neighbourhood, but the army came in. The [rebel] fighters were from outside Midan. Now it is free of all military opposition presence." In regards to the reported executions he said "I can't confirm or deny it. But I don't think execute is the right word. These people are fighters. They are not civilians. If they were killed it doesn't mean they were executed, and they were not captured and then killed. They were killed during the operation." He also added that Mezzeh was not fully under government control, with the eastern orchard being a hideout for rebels. He added "People are being encouraged to come back to Damascus. There's been a big media campaign by al-Jazeera and al-Arabiya making people believe that the whole area was under rebel control, but they only controlled some streets." Asked about Assad's whereabouts he said "I know he is in Damascus. The new minister of defence took the oath of office in the presidential palace with the president. This is the same room they have used for years."{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/middle-east-live/2012/jul/23/syria-damascus-aleppo-battles-live|title=Syria crisis: chemical weapon warning - 23 July 2012|author=Matthew Weaver|work=the Guardian|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|date=23 July 2012}} However, other civilians were terrified for Government reprisals to speak openly in front of a camera. Alex Thompson stated that in his journey to Midan terrified locals told him that "They used cannons, mortar, machine guns, tanks, they used helicopters – they use everything against us." Others said that the pro-Government militia, shabiba, massacred a family of sixteen in the district. Thompson claimed that the incident resembled the same "story we heard of Al-Houla" with "The familiar pattern of heavy shelling and bombardment followed by militia going house to house looting and massacring." Thompson described a scene in Midan of pulverised buildings and bodies lying on the streets.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.channel4.com/alex-thomsons-view/battle-midan/2389|title=After the battle of Midan|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} The corpses of 24 executed rebel fighters were found on 24 July in the suburbs of Daraya. Meanwhile, several shells hit the southern suburb of Hajar al-Aswad.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/07/24/us-syria-crisis-idUSBRE8610SH20120724|title=Syrian forces battle rebel push on central Aleppo|work=Reuters|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=24 July 2012}} The opposition reported that the Syrian Army attacked the last rebel pockets in the Damascus districts of Qaddam and al-Aswad.{{cite web|url=http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=422199|title=Syria army attacks Damascus rebel districts, activists say|date=24 July 2012|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} In other parts of the city, journalist Alex Thompson described that the battle as a victory for the Syrian Army, and a morale boost for the regime.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.channel4.com/alex-thomsons-view/assads-ironfist-defence-syrian-capital/2401|title=Assad's 'iron-fist defence' of Syrian capital|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} In the evening, activists confirmed that most of the rebels had withdrawn from the capital.[http://www.newsday.com/news/world/top-general-friend-of-syrian-president-defects-1.3856655 Top general, friend of Syrian president, defects] ===The battle concludes=== The rebel-held town of Al-Tal, on the outskirts of Damascus, was heavily bombarded on 25 July by the 216th Mechanized Battalion of the Syrian Army. Residents and opposition activists reported that residential buildings were hit.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/syrian-forces-have-reportedly-fired-artillery-and-rocket-barrages-rebel-held-damascus|title=Syrian forces have reportedly fired artillery and rocket barrages at rebel-held Damascus suburb of al-Tal|work=Al Jazeera Blogs|accessdate=25 October 2014}} On the same day, opposition activists released amateur footage of what they claimed were the bodies of 23 people in various houses who were "massacred" during the previous days in the Qaboun district.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18986411|title=UN's Ban Ki-moon urges end to Syria 'slaughter'|work=BBC News|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=25 July 2012}} On 26 July, fighting was reported in the Hajar al-Aswad district of the capital, a place described as one of the last rebel strongholds in Damascus.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/07/201272553949300881.html|title=Syria bolsters troops in battle for Aleppo|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} The FSA withdrew to the district which was subsequently shelled by government forces. According to an opposition activist, clashes continued across most of the southern part of the city.{{cite news|last=Weaver |first=Matthew |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/middle-east-live/2012/jul/26/syria-crisis-aleppo-battle-looms-live?intcmp=239#block-8 |title=Syria crisis: Aleppo battle looms|publisher=Guardian |date=26 July 2012 |accessdate=26 September 2012 |location=London}} Five civilians were reportedly killed.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jul/26/syrian-forces-gather-aleppo-assault|title=Syrian forces gather for Aleppo assault|author=Luke Harding|work=the Guardian|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|date=26 July 2012}} The army also attacked the Yarmouk Palestinian refugee camp, despite there being no rebel presence. Residents mentioned tanks, helicopter gunships and snipers who shot at anyone in the street. The FSA were reported to be in the district of Tadamon and shelling was still reported in the neighbourhoods of Orouba and Thalathin.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/syrian-forces-reportedly-attack-palestinian-refugee-camp-killing-least-five-civilians|title=Syrian forces reportedly attack Palestinian refugee camp, killing at least five civilians|work=Al Jazeera Blogs|accessdate=25 October 2014}} On 29 July, SANA reported that government troops had cleared the Hajar al-Aswad district of rebel forces[https://swap.stanford.edu/20120813042105/http%3A//english.farsnews.com/newstext.php?nn%3D9104251905 Syrian Army Disbands Tens of Terrorist Cells in Damascus] and the government declared "victory" in the capital.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2180750/Syrian-government-declares-victory-rebels-Damascus-onslaught-continues-countrys-largest-city.html|title=Syrian government declares victory over rebels in Damascus as onslaught continues in country's largest city|work=Mail Online|accessdate=25 October 2014|location=London|first=Anna|last=Edwards|date=29 July 2012}} Following the retreat of rebel forces from much the city, fighting continued. Rebel remnants, that did not pull back from Damascus with the other opposition forces, converged on the Tadamon district, where they made the area their final stronghold. The military launched an operation on 1 August to clear them out and by 3 August dozens of military vehicles had entered the district. During the fighting, on 2 August, mortars hit the nearby Yarmouk Palestinian refugee camp, killing 15-21 people.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-19106250|title=Syria crisis: Fighting rages ahead of UN Assembly vote|work=BBC News|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=3 August 2012}}[http://www.wctrib.com/event/article/id/96446/group/homepage/ In Syria, mortars kill 21 in Damascus refugee camp]{{dead link|date=July 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2012/aug/3/syria-mortars-kill-21-damascus-refugee-camp/|title=Mortars kill at least 20 in Damascus refugee camp|work=The Washingtion Times|accessdate=25 October 2014}} On 1 August, at the same time as the Tadamon operation started, the military raided the town of Jdaidet Artuz, southwest of Damascus, rounding up around 100 people suspected of being rebel sympathisers or opposition activists. The detainees were taken to a school where they were reportedly tortured and 43 of them were executed, according to SOHR.{{cite web|url=http://zeenews.india.com/news/world/assad-s-forces-raid-damascus-rebels-aim-aleppo-s-air-base_791272.html|title=Rebels blast Aleppo's air base using 'captured tanks'|work=Zee News|accessdate=25 October 2014}}{{cite news|title=Syria Video Purports To Show New Killings In Jdeidet Artouz (GRAPHIC) |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/08/02/syria-video-massacre-jdeidet-artouz_n_1733591.html |publisher=Huffington Post |date=2 August 2012 |accessdate=25 August 2012 |first=Eline |last=Gordts}} Syrian state media reported that the armed group located in the city was defeated, with dozens of insurgents killed, and that most of the others surrendered later. A picture of some prisoners was then published. The State media also reported that similar successful operations on Yalda and Babila took place against the insurgents.{{cite news |title=Authorities Pursue and Eliminate Large Numbers of Terrorists in Aleppo, Damascus, Homs, Deir Ezzor and Idleb |url=http://sana.sy/eng/337/2012/08/02/434287.htm |agency=[[Syrian Arab News Agency]] |date=2 August 2012 |accessdate=25 August 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120805233714/http://sana.sy/eng/337/2012/08/02/434287.htm# |archive-date=5 August 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} [[File:VOA Arrott - A View of Syria, Under Government Crackdown 05.jpg|thumb|A poster of Syria's president at a checkpoint on the outskirts of Damascus]] On 4 August, the Tadamon district was cleared of insurgents and the general who led the operation, which involved special forces, announced during a press tour of the quarter that the whole of Damascus had been secured and was under the full control of the Syrian Army.{{cite web|url=http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=425065|title=All of Damascus now under army control, general says|date=4 August 2012|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The Syrian Army reported that there were 800 rebels in Tadamon, and that 300 of them had been killed in the last assault.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/syrian-army-declares-al-tadamun-damascus-district-free-insurgency |title=Syrian army declares Al Tadamun in Damascus district as 'free of insurgency'|work=Al Jazeera|date=5 August 2012 |accessdate=26 September 2012}} The Army also uncovered a mass grave where 20 civilians and army personnel had been buried.{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/world/2012-08/04/c_131761563.htm |title=Syrian troops dig up mass grave in Damascus rebellious area|work=Xinhua|date=4 August 2012 |accessdate=26 September 2012}} Upon retaking the capital Damascus, the Syrian government began a campaign of collective punishment against the civilian residents of Sunni suburbs in-and-around the capital which had supported FSA presence in their neighborhoods.{{cite news|last=Yacoub |first=Khaled |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/09/03/us-syria-crisis-bulldozers-idUSBRE8820BC20120903 |title=Syria army destroys houses in collective punishment |publisher=Reuters |date= 3 September 2012|accessdate=26 September 2012}}{{cite web|last=Yacoub |first=Khaled |url=https://montrealgazette.com/news/Syria+army+bulldozes+houses+Sunni+Muslim+areas+collective+punishment/7187238/story.html |title=Syria army bulldozes houses in Sunni Muslim areas as "collective punishment" |publisher=Montrealgazette.com |date=4 September 2012 |accessdate=26 September 2012 |df=dmy }}{{dead link|date=January 2017|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} ==Aftermath== {{main|Rif Dimashq offensive (August–October 2012)}} [[File:Damascus (August 15 2012).svg|thumb|left|Situation in Damascus 15 August 2012]] Following the battle, the FSA stated that they were to conduct guerrilla hit-and-run attacks against security forces in the capital in the future.{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/news/world/story/2012-08-05/syria-forces-vow-decisive-battle/56809400/1|title=Syrian forces vow 'decisive' showdown for Aleppo|work=USATODAY.COM|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=5 August 2012}} On 11 August, the Syrian army clashed with rebels in the heart of Damascus near the Syrian central bank according to state TV and residents. An explosion was followed by fighting which appeared to be spreading, said the resident, who asked not to be named for fear of arrest. "The explosion was huge. There has been fighting for the past half an hour along Pakistan Street. I am very close. Can you hear that?" she asked, to the sound of a loud bang.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/08/11/us-syria-crisis-damascus-idUSBRE87A05920120811|title=Syrian forces, rebels clash in central Damascus|work=Reuters|accessdate=25 October 2014|first=Oliver|last=Holmes|date=11 August 2012}} On 15 August, the Free Syrian Army claimed it was behind a bomb attack on a military base near the UN hotel in central Damascus. Three people were injured. Afterwards, fighting between rebels and government forces took place in Mezzeh, near the Iranian embassy, and in the districts of Tadamon and Yarmouk.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/reports-more-fighting-damascus|title=Reports of more fighting in Damascus|work=Al Jazeera Blogs|accessdate=25 October 2014}} Also, al-Qadam and al-Asali were reportedly bombarded by the military and residents reported heavy gunfire.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/syrian-observatory-human-rights-sohr-says-there-firing-near-iranian-embassy-and-pms|title=Syrian Observatory for Human Rights (SOHR) says there is firing near the Iranian embassy and PM's office|work=Al Jazeera Blogs|accessdate=25 October 2014}} The military also freed the Al-Ikhbariya TV news team after an operation in the Damascus countryside.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriaonline.sy/?f=Details&catid=12&pageid=3325|title=Al-Ikhbariya TV Team Released from the Terrorist Groups|work=Syrian TV -Al-Ikhbariya TV Team Released from the Terrorist Groups|accessdate=25 October 2014}} Another nine people were also reportedly freed in other operations.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriaonline.sy/?f=Details&catid=12&pageid=3327|title=www.syriaonline.sy/?f=Details&catid=12&pageid=3327|work=Syrian TV -Terrorists Suffer Heavy Losses in Aleppo and Homs, 9 Citizens Released in Damascus Countryside|accessdate=25 October 2014}} The same day, the military launched a new offensive, with the aim of clearing rebel forces from towns around Damascus. During the operation, the Army captured the rebel-held towns of Al-Tall, Mouadamiya and Daraya{{cite news|title=Clashes erupt near Damascus military airport: watchdog |url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/clashes-erupt-near-damascus-military-airport-watchdog |publisher=[[Al Jazeera]] |date=17 August 2012 |accessdate=25 August 2012}}{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/08/21/us-syria-crisis-damsacus-idUSBRE87K0MF20120821|title=Assad's forces overrun Damascus suburb, kill 20|work=Reuters|accessdate=25 October 2014|date=21 August 2012}}{{cite news|title=Fierce fighting in Syria swells refugee exodus |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/08/24/us-syria-crisis-idUSBRE8610SH20120824 |last=Oweis |first=Khaled Y. |publisher=Reuters |date=24 August 2012 |accessdate=25 August 2012}} and the southern Damascus districts of Kfar Souseh and Nahr Aisha.[https://archive.is/20130130010736/http://www.newstimes.com/news/article/Syrian-forces-kill-at-least-31-in-Damascus-raids-3798926.php Syrian forces kill at least 31 in Damascus raids] During the attack on Daraya, the army reportedly committed a massacre, putting the blame on FSA (see [[Darayya massacre]]). On 26 September, Iranian state sponsored [[Press TV]] correspondent [[Maya Nasser]] was shot and killed by a sniper while reporting live.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/09/2012926115125431960.html|title=Press TV correspondent killed in Damascus|publisher=|accessdate=25 October 2014}} ==See also== * [[Battle of Tripoli (2011)]] * [[Rif Dimashq clashes (November 2011–March 2012)|2011–12 Damascus clashes]] * [[Battle of Aleppo (2012–16)]] ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} {{Syrian civil war}} {{Damascus}} {{coord missing|Syria}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Battle of Damascus}} [[Category:Damascus in the Syrian Civil War|Damascus]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War in 2012|Damascus]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Syrian government]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Free Syrian Army]] [[Category:July 2012 events in Asia]] [[Category:August 2012 events]] [[Category:Battles of the Syrian Civil War]]
