Nevertheless, the cancellation message did not reach everyone and thousands of guests and speakers arrived. Services were held unofficially. {{cite web|url=http://www.srk.fi/index.php?p=srkn_suviseurat|title=SRK:n Suviseurat|author=|year=2010|work=|publisher=SRK|accessdate=27 June 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130106221444/http://www.srk.fi/index.php?p=srkn_suviseurat|archivedate=6 January 2013|df=}} ==Summer services in North America== [[image:Perhon juhlaportti.JPG|thumb|right|Festival gate of Perho summer services in 2005]] Summer services in North America are arranged by members of the [[Laestadian Lutheran Church]]. They take place every year during the first weekend of July. They are mostly attended by North American guests, but some guests come from [[Finland]], [[Ecuador]], [[Togo]], and elsewhere. The service schedule consists of devotional speeches and [[Songs and Hymns of Zion]]. The purpose of the services is to invite all people to hear the Word of God. The core of the proclamation is the message of Jesus as the redeemer of sins and the call to repentance. ==Sources== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Suviseurat}} * [http://www.suviseurat.fi/2014/en/ Official English website of the Finnish Summer Services] * [http://www.llchurch.org Summer Services in North America] [[Category:Protestantism in Finland]] [[Category:Laestadianism]] [[Category:Events in Finland]] [[Category:Summer events in Finland]]

[[File:Fontana Drawing Giovanni e Paulo 1654.jpg|thumb|[[Carlo Fontana]]'s 1654 sketch of the theatre's floor plan]] The '''Teatro Santi Giovanni e Paolo''' (often written as '''Teatro SS. Giovanni e Paolo''') was a theatre and [[opera house]] in [[Venice]] located on the Calle della Testa, and takes its name from the nearby [[Santi Giovanni e Paolo, Venice|Basilica of Santi Giovanni e Paolo]], Venice. Built by the [[Grimani]] family in 1638, in its heyday it was considered the most beautiful and comfortable theatre in the city.Rosand (2007) p. 77 The theatre played an important role in the development of opera and saw the premieres of several works by [[Francesco Cavalli]], as well as [[Claudio Monteverdi|Monteverdi]]'s ''[[Il ritorno d'Ulisse in patria]]'' and ''[[L'incoronazione di Poppea]]''. ==History== [[File:Anna Renzi.jpg|thumb|left|[[Anna Renzi]] who sang Ottavia in the premiere of ''[[L'incoronazione di Poppea]]'']] The [[Grimani]] family originally built the theatre as a wooden structure on the Fondamenta Nuove around 1635. It was then rebuilt on a grander scale using both stone and wood in 1638 when it moved to the nearby Calle della Testa. It was built primarily for the performance of spoken drama, but from the very beginning operas were also performed there. In fact, the new theatre was inaugurated on 20 January 1639 with the premiere performance of [[Francesco Manelli]]'s opera ''La Delia o sia La sera sposa del sole''.Casaglia The librettist of ''La delia'', [[Giulio Strozzi]], became primarily based at the nearby [[Teatro Novissimo]] but returned to SS. Giovanni e Paolo for the 1642–1643 season, bringing with him the singers [[Barbara Strozzi]] and [[Anna Renzi]] (who sang Ottavia in the premiere of ''[[L'incoronazione di Poppea]]'') and the pioneering set designer [[Giacomo Torelli]]. According to Rosand, it may have been at Santi Giovanni e Paolo that Torelli developed his machinery for changing several sets simultaneously.Rosand (2007) p. 102 In 1654 the theatre was remodelled specifically as an opera house by the architect [[Carlo Fontana]] in one of his earliest commissions, and became the first fully developed horseshoe-shaped opera house in Italy,Forsyth (1985) p. 77 a design which remained essentially unchanged for over two centuries. Its magnificent interior could seat about 900 people with five tiers of [[Box (theatre)|boxes]] and additional seating on the U-shaped floor (or ''platea'') in front of the stage. The theatre was described in 1663 by an observer as having:
...marvellous scene changes, majestic and grand appearances [of performers] ... and a magnificent flying machine; you see, as if commonplace, glorious heavens, deities, seas, royal palaces, woods, forests...Ringer (2006) p. 217
[[Marco Faustini]]Marco Faustini's brother [[Giovanni Faustini]] was a well-known librettist, who for a time was also the impresario of two smaller Venetian opera houses, the [[Teatro San Cassiano]] and the [[Teatro San Moisè]]. became the theatre's [[impresario]] in 1660, and for the next fifteen years the Teatro Santi Giovanni e Paolo and the Teatro di San Salvatore a San Luca (owned by the [[Vendramin]] family) were to be the dominant opera houses in Venice, each putting on two new operas every year. By 1700, the Grimani family had built two more theatres in Venice, the [[Teatro San Samuele]] and the [[Teatro San Giovanni Grisostomo]]. An economic crisis made the Teatro Santi Giovanni e Paolo increasingly difficult to maintain, and it finally closed in 1715.Todarello (2006) p. 348. The Grimani family went on to build a fourth opera house, the [[Teatro San Benedetto]], in 1755. ==Premieres== [[File:Alboino in Italia frontispiece 1691.jpg|thumb|Libretto for ''L' Alboino in Italia'' which premiered at the Teatro Santi Giovanni e Paolo in 1691.]] Operas which had their first public performance at the theatre include: *''La Delia'' by [[Francesco Manelli]] (1639) *''[[Il ritorno d'Ulisse in patria]]'' by [[Claudio Monteverdi]] (1640) *''[[L'incoronazione di Poppea]]'' by Claudio Monteverdi (carnival season 1642/43) *''[[Xerse]]'' by [[Francesco Cavalli]] (1654) *''[[Statira principessa di Persia]]'' by Francesco Cavalli (1655, possibly 1656) *''[[Scipione affricano]]'' by Francesco Cavalli (1664) *''Il Tito'' by [[Antonio Cesti]] (1666) *''La Gerusalemme liberata'' by [[Carlo Pallavicino]] (1687) *''L' Alboino in Italia'' by [[Carlo Francesco Pollarolo]] (1691) *''Zenobia, regina de' Palmireni'' by [[Tomaso Albinoni]], (carnival season 1694) * ''Marsia deluso'' by [[Carlo Francesco Pollarolo|Francesco Pollarolo]] (1713) ==Notes and references== {{Reflist}} ==Sources== *{{Almanacco|match=SS. Giovanni e Paolo}} *Forsyth, Michael, [https://books.google.com/books?id=d7Y8AAAAIAAJ&q=%22Giovanni+e+Paolo%22#v=snippet&q=%22Giovanni%20e%20Paolo%22&f=false ''Buildings for Music: the architect, the musician and the listener from the seventeenth century to the present day''], [[Cambridge University Press|CUP Archive]], 1985. {{ISBN|0-521-26862-1}} *[[Mark Ringer|Ringer, Mark]], ''Opera's First Master: The Musical Dramas of Claudio Monteverdi'', Amadeus Press, 2006. {{ISBN|1-57467-110-3}}. *Rosand, Ellen, [https://books.google.com/books?id=OIldosPbzukC&pg=PA185&lpg=PA185&dq=Teatro+Giovanni+e+Paolo+venezia&source=bl&ots=2AT9xXRiMG&sig=uxNiBW4zPL7ScQ1uyKmNwniWCV0&hl=en&ei=DhjoSo3zMsTm-Qb1sv2IBw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CAoQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=%22Giovanni%20e%20Paolo%22&f=false ''Opera in Seventeenth-Century Venice: The Creation of a Genre''], University of California Press, 2007. {{ISBN|0-520-25426-0}} *Todarello, Nazzareno L., [https://books.google.com/books?id=7Y-uk9AHgS0C&q=%22Giovanni+e+Paolo%22#v=snippet&q=%22Giovanni%20e%20Paolo%22&f=false ''Le arti della scena: Lo spettacolo in Occidente da Eschilo al trionfo dell'opera''], Latorre Editore, 2006. {{ISBN|88-903202-0-6}} ==See also== [[Opera houses and theatres in Venice]] {{coord missing|Italy}} [[Category:Theatres in Venice]] [[Category:Opera houses in Italy|Santi Giovanni e Paolo]] [[Category:Theatres completed in 1638]] [[Category:Music venues completed in 1638]] [[Category:1638 establishments in the Republic of Venice]] [[Category:1638 establishments in Italy]]

{{Infobox GrandSlamTournaments | Name = The Championships, Wimbledon | Last = 2018 Wimbledon Championships | Last alias = 2018 Wimbledon | Current = | Current alias = | Logo = Wimbledon.svg | Logo size = 150ph | Bar Color = #C0D077 | Founded = {{start date and age|df=yes|1877}} | Editions = 132 (2018) | City = [[London]] | Country = England, UK | Venue = The [[All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club]] | Surface = [[Grass court|Grass]] outdoors{{efn|name=roof|Except [[Centre Court]] during rain.}} | Prize Money = [[Pound sterling|£]]34,000,000 (2018){{cite news|title=Prize Money and Finance|url=http://www.wimbledon.com/en_GB/aboutwimbledon/prize_money_and_finance.html|publisher=Wimbledon|accessdate=2 July 2018}} | Men Draw = 128S (128Q) / 64D (16Q){{efn|name=draw|This means that, in the men's main draws, there are 128 singles (S) and 64 doubles (D), and there are 128 and 16 entrants in the respective qualifying (Q) draws.}} | Men Current = [[Novak Djokovic]] ''(singles)''

[[Barbora Krejcikova]] / [[Katerina Siniakova]] ''(doubles)'' | Women Most S = [[Martina Navratilova]] (9) | Women Most D = [[Elizabeth Ryan]] (12) | Mixed Draw = 48 | Mixed Current = [[Nicole Melichar]] / [[Alexander Peya]] | Mixed Most M = [[Ken Fletcher]] (4)
